tp:docstring.p: An object representing a protocol for which this ConnectionManager can create Connections.

Each Protocol object has the same well-known bus name as its parent ConnectionManager. Its object path is formed by taking the ConnectionManager's object path and appending '/', followed by the Protocol name with any hyphen/minus '-' converted to underscores '_'.

tp:rationale.p: This is the same as the representation of protocol names in Account object paths, and in Connection object paths and bus names. For instance, telepathy-gabble and telepathy-salut would implement objects at /org/freedesktop/Telepathy/ConnectionManager/gabble/jabber and /org/freedesktop/Telepathy/ConnectionManager/salut/local_xmpp, respectively.

tp:docstring.p: A list of interfaces supported by this Protocol object.
This property is immutable, and should not be confused with GuaranteedInterfaces and PossibleInterfaces, which refer to the interfaces of connections to this protocol.
The parameters which must or may be provided to the RequestConnection method when connecting to the given protocol. This property is immutable.
A list of interface names which will definitely be in the Interfaces property of any Connection to this protocol.
This property is immutable, and should not be confused with Interfaces.
A list of interface names which will might be in the Interfaces property of a Connection to this protocol, or not, depending on server capabilities.
This property is immutable, and should not be confused with Interfaces.
A list of channel classes which will be requestable from any Connection to this protocol (i.e. they are guaranteed to appear in the Connection's RequestableChannelClasses property).

A list of channel classes which might be requestable from a Connection to this protocol, or not, depending on capability discovery (i.e. might appear in the Connection's RequestableChannelClasses property, or not).
Return a string which uniquely identifies the account to which the given parameters would connect.

tp:rationale.p: For many protocols, this would return the well-known 'account' parameter. However, for IRC the returned string would be composed from the 'account' (i.e. nickname) and 'server' parameters. AccountManager implementations can use this to form the account-specific part of an Account's object path.

arg.name: Parameters
arg.tp:docstring: A set of parameters as would be provided to RequestConnection

tp:docstring.p: An opaque string suitable for use as the account-specific part of an Account's object path. This is not necessarily globally unique, but should represent a "best-effort" identification of the account.

tp:rationale.p: For a pathological case, consider a user signing in as 'me@example.com' with 'server' set to either jabber1.example.com or jabber2.example.com. Both of these should result in me@example.com being returned from this method, even if the user can actually be signed in to those two servers simultaneously.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.NotImplemented
tp:error.tp:docstring: The IdentifyAccount method is not supported by this connection manager. The caller SHOULD fall back to deriving identification from the parameters.

tp:docstring.p: Attempt to normalize the given contact ID. Where possible, this SHOULD return the same thing that would be returned by InspectHandles(RequestHandles(CONTACT, [Contact_ID])) on a connected Connection.
If full normalization requires network activity or is otherwise impossible to do without a Connection, this method SHOULD perform a best-effort normalization.

arg.name: Contact_ID
arg.tp:docstring: The identifier of a contact in this protocol

arg.name: Normalized_Contact_ID
arg.tp:docstring: The identifier of a contact in this protocol, normalized as much as possible

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.NotImplemented
tp:error.tp:docstring: The NormalizeContact method is not supported by this connection manager. The caller MAY recover by using the contact ID as-is.
